snippet: Guo Shengkun, China’s minister of public security, said that Russia and Central Asian countries must prevent “external forces” from trying to overthrow governments and provoke revolutions.
abstract: Guo Shengkun, China's minister of public security, says that Russia and Central Asian countries must strictly control Internet to prevent Western nations from trying to overthrow governments; makes remarks at meeting of Shanghai Cooperation Organization, six-nation security alliance, at conference in Tajikistan.
lead_paragraph: Guo Shengkun, China’s minister of public security, said that Russia and Central Asian countries must prevent “external forces” from trying to overthrow governments and provoke revolutions.

headline.main: Chinese Official Urges Russia and Central Asian Allies to Control Internet
headline.print_headline: China: Allies Urged to Control Internet
